intro: Tragia praetervisa var. unicolor, commonly known as the one-colored tragia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species in botanical studies.
